```{r}
library(MASS)
library(ISLR2)
rm(list=ls())
attach(Carseats)
```

10a)

```{r}
mlr_Sales = lm(Sales ~ Price+Urban+US)
summary(mlr_Sales)
```

10b) For every 1 increase in price Sales tends to decrease by 0.054459. If Urban is Yes, Sales tends to decrease by .0.021916, If US is Yes, Sales tends to increase by 1.200573.

10c) PredictedSales = 13.043469 \* Price - 0.054459 \* UrbanYes + 1.200573 \* USYes

10d) Price and US'snull hypothesis can be rejected

10e)

```{r}
mlr_Sales2 = lm(Sales ~ Price+US)
summary(mlr_Sales2)

```

f) According to adj. R\^2, neither modes explain the model well, with both of the models only explaining around 23% of the variation.

g)

```{r}
confint(mlr_Sales2)
```

h) There are two outliers for US, and three high leverage points in Price.

```{r}
plot(Price,Sales)
plot(US,Sales)
```
